articles.author: Gabriela Miranda, USA TODAY
articles.title: 'Dangerous to hunt illegally': Elephant kills poacher in South Africa, park officials suspect - USA TODAY
articles.description: An alleged poacher was found dead and likely killed by an elephant on Thursday. A national park said the person was killed and "left behind."
articles.content:
An alleged poacher was found dead and likely killed by an elephant on Thursday, according to a South African national park.

articles.title: Brian Laundrie's remains have been sent to an anthropologist - Business Insider South Africa
articles.description: Brian Laundrie's bones were found this week at a Florida nature preserve. The 23-year-old was a person of interest in the killing of Gabby Petito.

articles.title: SA rates will be hiked if inflation persists, says Kganyago - News24
articles.description: South Africa will raise its benchmark interest rate if accelerating inflation becomes persistent, central bank Governor Lesetja Kganyago said.

articles.author: Ray Ndlovu
articles.title: Beitbridge chaos: Zimbabwe forms crisis team to ease 10km queues at border - TimesLIVE
articles.description: Zimbabwe has formed a crisis team to clear traffic at Beitbridge, one of Africa’s busiest border posts, which is undergoing a R4.45bn revamp.

articles.title: Eswatini bans protests as hospital floors 'drenched in blood', mediation begins - News24
articles.description: Africa's last absolute monarchy Eswatini has banned protests as regional mediators landed in the kingdom amid rumbling pro-democracy demonstrations.
articles.content:

articles.author: Rob Houwing, Sport24 chief writer
articles.title: T20 World Cup: Proteas can only afford ONE group slip-up | Sport - News24
articles.description: South Africa will already be under heavy pressure, semis-wise, if they lose their opening T20 World Cup fixture, explains Rob Houwing.
articles.content: Quickly onto the tournament back foot: that will be the status of the losers of Saturday’s ICC T20 World Cup-proper opening match between South Africa and Australia in Abu Dhabi (12:00 SA time).
